--- title: Pandas lang: en subtitle: Introduction author: Jan Kirenz execute: eval: true echo: true highlight-style: github format: revealjs: toc: true toc-depth: 1 embed-resources: false theme: [dark, ../custom.scss] incremental: true transition: slide background-transition: fade transition-speed: slow code-copy: true code-line-numbers: true smaller: false scrollable: true slide-number: c preview-links: auto chalkboard: buttons: false #logo: images/logo.png footer: Jan Kirenz --- # Pandas introduction ## Import pandas - To load the pandas package and start working with it, import the package. - The community agreed alias for pandas is `pd` . . . ::: {#4c949cd7 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd ``` ::: # Create and Import Data ## Data creation - To manually store data in a table, create a DataFrame: ::: {#0d85fd5c .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1|2|3|4|5|"} df = pd.DataFrame({ 'name': ["Tom", "Lisa", "Peter"], 'height': [1.68, 1.93, 1.72], 'weight': [48.4, 89.8, 84.2] }) ``` ::: ## Show data ::: {#df6b2837 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
name height weight
0 Tom 1.68 48.4
1 Lisa 1.93 89.8
2 Peter 1.72 84.2
``` ::: ::: ## Import data - Import data with the prefix `.read_*` ![](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/_images/02_io_readwrite.svg) ## Import data - Import a CSV file in a GitHub repo . . . ::: {#beccd178 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1|3|5|"} URL = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kirenz/datasets/master/campaign.csv" df_github = pd.read_csv(URL, sep=",", decimal='.') df_github.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}
age city income membership_days campaign_engagement target
0 56 Berlin 136748 837 3 1
1 46 Stuttgart 25287 615 8 0
2 32 Berlin 146593 2100 3 0
3 60 Berlin 54387 2544 0 0
4 25 Berlin 28512 138 6 0
``` ::: ::: ## Store data - Store data with the prefix `.to_*` . . . ::: {#9d088da1 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} df_github.to_csv("data.csv", index=False) ``` ::: - By setting `index=False` the row index labels are not saved in the spreadsheet # Viewing data ## Overview ::: {#f1b64cb9 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} df ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html}
name height weight
0 Tom 1.68 48.4
1 Lisa 1.93 89.8
2 Peter 1.72 84.2
``` ::: ::: ## Head and tail ::: {#01ce2d4d .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} # show first 2 rows df.head(2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7} ```{=html}
name height weight
0 Tom 1.68 48.4
1 Lisa 1.93 89.8
``` ::: ::: . . . ::: {#992fade4 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} # show last 2 rows df.tail(2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ```{=html}
name height weight
1 Lisa 1.93 89.8
2 Peter 1.72 84.2
``` ::: ::: ## Info - The `info()` method prints information about a DataFrame. . . . ::: {#73621537 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.info() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` RangeIndex: 3 entries, 0 to 2 Data columns (total 3 columns): # Column Non-Null Count Dtype --- ------ -------------- ----- 0 name 3 non-null object 1 height 3 non-null float64 2 weight 3 non-null float64 dtypes: float64(2), object(1) memory usage: 204.0+ bytes ``` ::: ::: ## Column names ::: {#45173026 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ``` Index(['name', 'height', 'weight'], dtype='object') ``` ::: ::: ## Data type - Show data types ([dtypes](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/user_guide/basics.html#basics-dtypes)). ::: {#16a3c48e .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.dtypes ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=11} ``` name object height float64 weight float64 dtype: object ``` ::: ::: - The data types in this DataFrame are integers (int64), floats (float64) and strings (object). ### Index ::: {#c7f3cd9f .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.index ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=12} ``` RangeIndex(start=0, stop=3, step=1) ``` ::: ::: # Change column names ## Column names Usually, we prefer to work with columns that have the following proporties: - no leading or trailing whitespace (`"name"` instead of `" name "`, `" name"` or `"name "`) - all lowercase (`"name"` instead of `"Name"`) - now white spaces (`"my_name"` instead of `"my name"`) ## Simple rename - First, we rename columns by simply using a mapping - We rename `"name"` to `" NAME"` (note that we include a white space) . . . ::: {#478fd820 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} df = df.rename(columns={"name": " NEW$NAME"}, errors="raise") df.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=13} ```{=html}
NEW$NAME height weight
0 Tom 1.68 48.4
1 Lisa 1.93 89.8
2 Peter 1.72 84.2
``` ::: ::: . . . ::: {#98084d45 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} ``` Index([' NEW$NAME', 'height', 'weight'], dtype='object') ``` ::: ::: ## Trailing and leading spaces (with regex) - We use regular expressions to deal with whitespaces - To change multiple column names in `df` at once, we use the method `df.columns = df.columns.str___` - To replace the spaces, we use `.replace()` with `regex=True` ## Regular expressions Explanation for *regex* (see also [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/a/67466222)): - we start with `r` (for raw) which tells Python to treat all following input as raw text (without interpreting it) - "`^`": is line start - " ": is a white space - "`+`": some following characters - "`|`": is or - "`$`": is line end - "": is an empty string ## Regular expressions To learn more about regular expressions ("regex"), visit the following sites: - [regular expression basics](https://www.w3schools.com/python/python_regex.asp). - [interactive regular expressions tool](https://regex101.com/) ## Trailing and leading spaces (with regex) - In the following function, we search for leading spaces and replace them with an empty string: . . . ::: {#d7aa3c93 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns = df.columns.str.replace(r"^ ", r"", regex=True) ``` ::: . . . ::: {#1b4cae86 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ``` Index(['NEW$NAME', 'height', 'weight'], dtype='object') ``` ::: ::: ## Replace special characters - Again, we use regular expressions to deal with special characters (like %, &, $ etc.) Replace "$" with "_" . . . ::: {#578bc140 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns = df.columns.str.replace(r"$", r"_", regex=True) ``` ::: . . . ::: {#f5a86e9a .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=18} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=18} ``` Index(['NEW_NAME', 'height', 'weight'], dtype='object') ``` ::: ::: ## Lowercase and whitespace We can use two simple methods to convert all columns to lowercase and replace white spaces with underscores ("_"): - `.str.lower()` - `.str.replace(' ', '_')` . . . ::: {#5d6bdb82 .cell output-location='fragment' execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} df.columns = df.columns.str.lower().str.replace(' ', '_') ``` :::
